H0.text: Move is what Paramecium do with their tiny hair‑like cilia.

H1.text: Fight is what the tiny hair‑like cilia of Paramecium help them do.

H2.text: Look is what Paramecium's tiny hair-like cilia help them do.

H3.text: Breed is what the tiny hair‑like cilia help Paramecium do.

A4.text: The Paramecium propels itself by whip‑like movements of the cilia, which are arranged in tightly spaced rows around the outside of the body.

A5.text: When it encounters an obstacle, the effective stroke of its cilia is reversed, causing the organism to swim backward briefly before resuming forward progress.
